page.title: 05SUSSEX COUNTY HOSPITAL 2
page.content: The Trevor Mann baby unit provides special facilities for the care of babies in the nurseries, each with places for 7 cots and incubators. There is also a lounge for mothers. Visitors have to wear special gowns before entering the unit for reasons of cleanliness. Babies can survive at this hospital up to three months premature. A #26,000 scanning machine detects brain damage of any sort in the baby. Money was raised for the scanner and presented to the unit. It compares extremely favourably with other such units in England. The heart unit does not deal with open heart surgery as this is carried out at King's College Hospital in London but it was one of the first units to introduce special life saving equipment in their cardiac ambulances.
